conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D and pass through baffles to reach containers E, F, or G.
Source A is located at the top left, Source B is next to A, Source C is next to B, and Source D is at the far right.
Container E is green, Container F is red, and Container G is white, located at the bottom of the structure.
There are slanted baffles in the structure: black, yellow, white, and grey.

premise: Liquid flows downward from Source A and encounters the black slanted baffle.
conclusion: The black slanted baffle deflects the liquid from Source A to the right.

premise: Liquid deflected to the right from Source A flows over the next horizontal baffle and continues downward.
conclusion: Liquid from Source A reaches the lower part of the structure and flows into Container E.

premise: Liquid flows downward from Source B and encounters the black slanted baffle.
conclusion: The black slanted baffle deflects the liquid from Source B to the left.

premise: Liquid deflected to the left from Source B flows over the next horizontal baffle and continues downward.
conclusion: Liquid from Source B reaches the lower part of the structure and flows into Container F.

premise: Liquid flows downward from Source C and encounters the yellow slanted baffle.
conclusion: The yellow slanted baffle deflects the liquid from Source C to the right.

premise: Liquid deflected to the right from Source C flows over the next horizontal baffle and continues downward.
conclusion: Liquid from Source C reaches the lower part of the structure and flows into Container G.

premise: Liquid flows downward from Source D and encounters no immediate baffles.
conclusion: Liquid from Source D flows straight down.

premise: Liquid flowing straight down from Source D reaches the lower part of the structure.
conclusion: Liquid from Source D flows into Container G.

premise: Liquid from Sources A and B merge after being deflected by the black slanted baffle.
conclusion: The merged liquid from Sources A and B bifurcates into two streams after straddling the white slanted baffle.

premise: One branch of the bifurcation from Sources A and B flows into Container E, and the other flows into Container F.
conclusion: Container F has a higher liquid level than Container E due to the bifurcation.
